intro: Atelandra obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its milky sap and often showy floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, waxy leaves that are broad and rounded at the tips. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized leaf-like structures called bracts. Atelandra obtusifolia is adapted to dry environments and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
